nodes.label: Photosynthesis-related genes (31 ORFs)
nodes.description: A set of 31 open reading frames identified in *Chlorobium tepidum* and *Chloroflexus aurantiacus* associated with bacteriochlorophyll/porphyrin biosynthesis, carotenoid biosynthesis, and photosynthetic electron transfer, spanning approximately 100 kb of genomic sequence.

nodes.label: Chlorobium tepidum
nodes.description: Green sulfur bacterium used as a source of photosynthesis-related gene sequences, contributing to understanding of anoxygenic photosynthesis evolution.

nodes.label: Chloroflexus aurantiacus
nodes.description: Green nonsulfur bacterium providing gene sequences related to photosynthesis, aiding in phylogenetic analysis of early phototrophs.

nodes.label: Bacteriochlorophyll biosynthesis pathway
nodes.description: A biosynthetic pathway responsible for producing bacteriochlorophyll, suggested to have evolved prior to chlorophyll biosynthesis, indicating an early origin in photosynthetic evolution.

nodes.label: Chlorophyll biosynthesis pathway
nodes.description: The pathway for chlorophyll production, proposed to have evolved after bacteriochlorophyll biosynthesis, challenging previous hypotheses about the order of photosynthetic pigment evolution.

nodes.label: Heliobacteria
nodes.description: Closest to the last common ancestor of all oxygenic photosynthetic lineages according to phylogenetic analyses, indicating an early divergence in photosynthetic evolution.

nodes.label: Green sulfur bacteria
nodes.description: Phototrophic bacteria closely related to green nonsulfur bacteria, with phylogenetic analyses suggesting they are each other's closest relatives.

nodes.label: Green nonsulfur bacteria
nodes.description: Phototrophic bacteria identified as closely related to green sulfur bacteria, involved in early photosynthetic evolution studies.

nodes.label: Purple bacteria
nodes.description: Lineage identified as the earliest phototrophic group, predating other bacterial photosynthetic lineages, challenging previous hypotheses about early phototrophs.

nodes.label: Phylogenetic analysis methods
nodes.description: Various phylogenetic methods used to analyze gene sequences, supporting the evolutionary relationships among photosynthetic bacteria and challenging previous hypotheses.

nodes.label: Evolution of photosynthesis
nodes.description: The development of photosynthetic capability in bacteria, with molecular evidence suggesting bacteriochlorophyll biosynthesis predates chlorophyll biosynthesis, indicating an earlier origin.

nodes.label: Granick hypothesis
nodes.description: Previous hypothesis proposing that chlorophyll biosynthesis preceded bacteriochlorophyll biosynthesis, challenged by current molecular evidence.

nodes.label: Genomic sequence (~100 kb)
nodes.description: Approximately 100 kb of genomic sequence containing the 31 photosynthesis-related open reading frames, providing a basis for phylogenetic and functional analyses.

nodes.label: Molecular evidence
nodes.description: Data derived from gene sequences and phylogenetic analyses supporting the early evolution of photosynthesis and the relative timing of biosynthetic pathway emergence.

nodes.label: Photosynthetic electron transfer
nodes.description: A key process in photosynthesis involving electron transfer, encoded by specific genes identified in the studied genomes, indicating early development of photosynthetic machinery.

nodes.label: Carotenoid biosynthesis genes
nodes.description: Genes involved in carotenoid biosynthesis found within the gene cluster, contributing to photoprotection and light harvesting in early photosynthetic bacteria.

nodes.label: Porphyrin biosynthesis genes
nodes.description: Genes related to porphyrin biosynthesis, essential for chlorophyll and bacteriochlorophyll production, indicating the molecular basis for pigment synthesis.

nodes.label: Phylogenetic relationships
nodes.description: The inferred evolutionary relationships among bacterial lineages based on gene sequence analyses, supporting the early emergence of purple bacteria and the placement of heliobacteria.

nodes.label: Early evolution of photosynthesis
nodes.description: The process and timeline of the emergence of photosynthesis in bacteria, with molecular data indicating an earlier origin than previously thought.

nodes.label: Implications for Earth's photosynthetic development
nodes.description: The findings suggest that photosynthetic pathways and lineages emerged earlier, reshaping understanding of the development of photosynthetic life on Earth.
